An R package consisting of dictionaries for text analysis and associated utilities. Designed to be used with [**quanteda**](http://quanteda.io) but can be used more generally with any text analytic package (e.g. **tidytext**, **tm**, etc.).

## Installing

```{r eval = FALSE}
# the devtools package needs to be installed for this to work
devtools::install_github("kbenoit/quanteda.dictionaries") 
```

## Demonstration

With the `liwcalike()` function from the **quanteda.dictionaries** package, you can easily analyze text corpora using exising or custom dictionaries. Here we show how to apply the Lexicoder Sentiment Dictionary (Young and Soroka 2012) to a corpus consting of 2000 movie reviews (from the [**quanteda.corpora**](https://github.com/quanteda/quanteda.corpora) package).

```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library("quanteda.dictionaries")

output_lsd <- liwcalike(quanteda.corpora::data_corpus_movies, 
                        dictionary = data_dictionary_NRC)

head(output_lsd)
```
